verses.verse: In such a way, my loved and yearned for brothers, my happiness and award wreath, stand like this in the Master, loved ones.
I encourage Euodia and I encourage Suntuche to be focusing on the same thing in the Master.

And I also ask you, my real strapped together with me brother, take them in together, some who competed together as a team in the good news for me with both Clement and the rest of my co-workers, whose names are in the scroll of life.
Always be happy in the Master. Again I will state, "Be happy."
Your polite nature must be known to all people. The Master is near.
Worry about nothing, but in everything by the prayer and the plea with thankfulness, your requests must be made known to God.
And the peace of God, the peace that has a higher position of every way of thinking, will watch over your hearts and your thought processes in the Anointed King Jesus.

For the rest of the time, brothers, as many things as are truthful, as many as are respectful, as many as are right, as many as are consecrated, as many as are toward friendship, as many as are good sounding, if there is any achievement and if there is any high praise, consider these things.
What you also learned, took in, heard, and realized in me, these things you must constantly do, and the God of the peace will be with you.
But I was immensely happy in the Master because finally you again flourished the "to be focusing on my behalf" thing, on which you actually were focusing, but you were not at the right time.
Not that I am talking regarding a deficit, you see, I learned to be content in situations that I am in.

I realize both what it is like to be put down low and I realize what it is like to be overflowing. In every and in all situations, I have been secretly instructed to both be full and to be hungry, to both be overflowing and to be lacking.
I have strength for all things in the Anointed King who gives ability to me.
More importantly, you did nicely when you shared together in my hard times.
You also realize, Philippians, that in the beginning of the good news when I went out from Macedonia, not even one assembly shared with me for an account of giving and receiving except you alone,
that even in Thessalonica, both once and twice, you sent money to me for the need.
Not that I am looking for the present, but I am looking for the fruit, the fruit increasing in your account.

I have all of everything, and I overflow. I have been filled up after accepting from the side of Epaphroditus the things from the side of you, an aroma of a sweet fragrance, an accepted sacrifice very satisfying to God.
My God will fill up every need of yours in line with His wealth in magnificence in the Anointed King Jesus.
To our God and Father belongs the magnificence for the spans of time of the spans of time. Amen.
Say hello to every sacred person in the Anointed King Jesus. The brothers together with me say hello to you.
All the sacred people say hello to you, but especially the people from the house of Caesar.
May the generosity of our Master Jesus, the Anointed King, be with you all. Amen. [Written to Philippians from Rome and sent through Epaphroditus]
